item.title: Lisa add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A word to the wise is infuriating. " -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Yet once you've come to be part of this particular patch, you'll never love another. Like loving a woman with a broken nose, you may well find lovelier lovelies. But never a lovely so real." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "I am an American, Chicago born – Chicago, that somber city – and go at things as I have taught myself, free-style, and will make the record in my own way: first to knock, first admitted; sometimes an innocent knock, sometimes a not so innocent. But a man's character is his fate, says Heraclitus, and in the end there isn't any way to disguise the nature of the knocks by acoustical work on the door or gloving the knuckles." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "One of the first conditions of happiness is that the link between Man and Nature shall not be broken." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Lisa add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Nothing is so necessary for a young man as the company of intelligent women." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Big-shot town, small-shot town, jet-propelled old-fashioned town, by old-world hands with new-world tools built into a place whose heartbeat carries farther than its shout, whose whispering in the night sounds less hollow than its roistering noontime laugh: they have builded a heavy-shouldered laughter here who went to work too young." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "That’s the struggle of humanity, to recruit others to your version of what’s real" -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "There are some people who can receive a truth by no other way than to have their understanding shocked and insulted" -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description:
"So we all love a wild girl keeping a hold
On a dream she wants." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "I am stone and steel of your sleeping numbers; I remember all you forget. I will die as many times as you make me over again." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lisa Lang
item.description: "He imagines Owens' body dotted with saltwater reservoirs just below the skin. An entire wetland, populated with tiny fish and birds, thriving in his agitation. A species of dwarf crocodile lazing beside an artery." -- Lisa Lang

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Card, Orson Scott
item.description: "You take a step, then another. That’s the journey. But to take a step with your eyes open is not a journey at all, it’s a remaking of your own mind." -- Card, Orson Scott
